name: Bool.Extra

values.name: all
values.comment:
All the bools are true.

    all [ True, True, True ]
    --> True

    all [ True, False ]
    --> False

    all [ False, False ]
    --> False

values.name: allPass
values.comment:
Determine if all predicates are satisfied by the value.

    allPass [ (>) 20, (<) 10 ] 11
    --> True

    allPass [ (>) 20, (<) 10 ] 21
    --> False

    allPass [ (>) 20, (<) 10 ] 4
    --> False

    allPass [] 21
    --> True

values.name: any
values.comment:
At least one of the bools is true.

    any [ True, True ]
    --> True

    any [ True, False ]
    --> True

    any [ False, False ]
    --> False

values.name: anyPass
values.comment:
Determine if any predicate is satisfied by the value.

    anyPass [ (>) 20, (<) 10 ] 100
    --> True

    anyPass [ (>) 20, (==) 10 ] 21
    --> False

    anyPass [] 21
    --> False

values.name: encodeAsString
values.comment:
Sometimes in weird unideal circumstances you need to encode `True` to `"true"` instead of just `true`.

    import Json.Encode exposing (encode)

    encode 0 (encodeAsString True)
    --> "\"true\""

    encode 0 (encodeAsString False)
    --> "\"false\""

values.name: fromString
values.comment:
Try and extract a `Bool` from a `String`

    fromString "true"
    --> Just True

    fromString "False"
    --> Just False

    fromString "t"
    --> Nothing

    fromString "My pal foot foot"
    --> Nothing

values.name: none
values.comment:
None of the bools are true.

    none [ True, True ]
    --> False

    none [ True, False ]
    --> False

    none [ False, False ]
    --> True

values.name: notAll
values.comment:
Not all of them are true

    notAll [ True, True ]
    --> False

    notAll [ True, False ]
    --> True

    notAll [ False, False ]
    --> True

values.name: stringDecoder
values.comment:
Sometimes webservers will return the unideal json of a string `"true"` rather than just the native boolean value `true`. This decoder decodes a string that looks like a `Bool`, into a `Bool`

    import Json.Decode as Decode
    import Json.Encode as Encode

    Decode.decodeString stringDecoder "\"true\""
    --> Ok True

    Decode.decodeString stringDecoder "true"
    --> Err (Decode.Failure "Expecting a STRING" (Encode.bool True))

values.name: toMaybe
values.comment:
Take a value, and wrap it with `Just` from a `Bool`

    toMaybe 4 True
    --> Just 4

    toMaybe 4 False
    --> Nothing

values.name: toString
values.comment:
Turn a bool into a string

    toString True
    --> "True"

    toString False
    --> "False"
